Home → Events and activities → Suffolk Libraries Presents

Amazing performances and cultural events recorded live and screened at your library using top quality projection equipment.

New York City Ballet's The Nutcracker at Capel St Mary Library

Capel St Mary Library · Thu 24 Nov 2016, 1345 -1545 · £8 (inc refreshments)
For tickets visit or call Capel St Mary Library

In the New York City Ballet’s famously extravagant staging of Tchaikovsky’s beloved melodies, one of the most complex theatrical staged ballets in the Company's active repertory, George Balanchine’s stunning choreography shines amidst awe-inspiring set pieces.

Matthew Bourne's The Car Man at Capel St Mary Library

Capel St Mary Library · Thu 26 Jan 2017, 1345 -1545 · £8 (inc refreshments)
For tickets visit or call Capel St Mary Library

Loosely based on Bizet’s popular opera, Carmen, with one of the most thrilling and instantly recognisable scores in classical music, the familiar 19th Century Spanish cigarette factory becomes a greasy garage-diner in 1960’s America where the dreams and passions of a small-town are shattered by the arrival of a handsome stranger.

The Merchant of Venice at Felixstowe Library

Felixstowe Library · Fri 11 Nov 2016, 1900 · £7.50 (advance bookings only)
For tickets visit or call Felixstowe Library

In Venice, the epicentre of consumption, speculation and debt, Bassanio borrows money from his friend Antonio to finance his attempt to win the hand of Portia. Antonio, in turn, takes out a loan from the moneylender Shylock. The loan will be repaid when Antonio’s ships return to the city. But if they should fail, and the money cannot be repaid, Antonio shall give to Shylock a pound of his own flesh. In some of his most highly-charged scenes, Shakespeare dramatises the competing claims of tolerance and intolerance, justice and mercy.

New York City Ballet's The Nutcracker at Felixstowe Library

Felixstowe Library · Fri 9 Dec 2016, 1900 · £7.50 (advance bookings only)
For tickets visit or call Felixstowe Library

In the New York City Ballet’s famously extravagant staging of Tchaikovsky’s beloved melodies, one of the most complex theatrical staged ballets in the Company's active repertory, George Balanchine’s stunning choreography shines amidst awe-inspiring set pieces.

David Suchet in The Importance of Being Earnest at Gainsborough Community Library

Gainsborough Community Library · Sat 29 Oct 2016, 1400 · £7.50  
For tickets visit or call Gainsborough Community Library

Recorded at the Vaudeville Theatre in London, Adrian Noble's production of Wilde's classic play is majestically amusing. Stars David Suchet as Lady Bracknell.

Matthew Bourne's Swan Lake at Gainsborough Community Library

Gainsborough Community Library · Sat 26 Nov 2016, 1430 and 1800 · £7.50  
For tickets visit or call Gainsborough Community Library

When it premiered at Sadler’s Wells in 1995, Matthew Bourne’s triumphant re-interpretation of Swan Lake turned tradition upside down, taking the dance world by storm. An iconic production, breathtaking in its drama and intensity, perhaps best known for replacing the traditional female corps de ballet with a menacing male ensemble. With numerous international theatre awards, Swan Lake has been acclaimed as a landmark achievement on the stage, becoming the longest running ballet in the West End and on Broadway, with more than 30 international theatre awards.

New York City Ballet The Nutcracker at Gainsborough Community Library

Gainsborough Community Library · Thu 22 Dec 2016, 1800 · £8
For tickets visit or call Gainsborough Community Library

In the New York City Ballet’s famously extravagant staging of Tchaikovsky’s beloved melodies, one of the most complex theatrical staged ballets in the Company's active repertory, George Balanchine’s stunning choreography shines amidst awe-inspiring set pieces.

Twelfth Night at Ixworth Library

Ixworth Library · Sun 18 Dec 2016, 1530 · £7.50 (advance bookings only)
For tickets visit or call Ixworth Library

Outrageous high comedy ensues as the pangs of unrequited love affect the unforgettable characters of Shakespeare’s Twelfth Night. While the lovelorn Duke Orsino plots to win the heart of the mourning Olivia, an alliance of servants and hangers-on scheme against the high-handedness of Olivia’s steward, the pompous Malvolio. When Orsino engages the cross-dressed Viola, who has disguised herself as a young man under the name Cesario, to plead with Olivia on his behalf, a bittersweet and hilarious chain of events follows.

New York City Ballet's The Nutcracker at Lowestoft Library

Lowestoft Library · Fri 16 Dec 2016, 1900 · £7.50 (advance bookings only)
For tickets visit or call Lowestoft Library

In the New York City Ballet’s famously extravagant staging of Tchaikovsky’s beloved melodies, one of the most complex theatrical staged ballets in the Company's active repertory, George Balanchine’s stunning choreography shines amidst awe-inspiring set pieces.

About

Suffolk Libraries Presents brings quality theatre and exhibition events to Suffolk communities using the latest digital screening equipment.

It’s funded by Arts Council England and runs in several of the county’s libraries with the aim of bringing more Suffolk residents into contact with the arts in a familiar and accessible local venue.

Digitally recorded, internationally acclaimed performance and exhibition events will be screened using the latest projection equipment in Stradbroke, Felixstowe, Ixworth, Gainsborough, Hadleigh, Lowestoft and Capel St Mary libraries.

The performances will include the Globe Theatre’s productions of Julius Caesar and The Comedy of Errors; well-known ballets such as Matthew Bourne’s productions of Sleeping Beauty and Swan Lake; and unique, commentated tours of visual art exhibitions featuring artists such as Matisse, Rembrant and Van Gogh.
